intro: Disphyma crassifolium, commonly known as the thick-leaved disphyma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, thick, fleshy leaves that help it store water in arid environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions of Australia. Disphyma crassifolium is well adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant in suitable climates.
